dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Oil and gas production is where Michael Bloomberg is putting his money and his focus for the next two years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oil and gas production is where Michael Bloomberg is putting his money and his focus for the next two years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge shift from his previous climate initiatives, right? He's completely pivoting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge shift from his previous climate initiatives, right? He's completely pivoting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy. His foundation has already worked to shutter coal-fired power plants and reduce air pollution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's also planning to spend, um, five hundred million dollars of his own money to help Trump's campaign.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's also planning to spend, um, five hundred million dollars of his own money to help Trump's campaign.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild because he spent a hundred million against Republicans just a few years ago in the midterms. It's a total reversal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild because he spent a hundred million against Republicans just a few years ago in the midterms. It's a total reversal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he's not even running himself! He wrote that he's convinced he would lose to Trump in a general election.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's not even running himself! He wrote that he's convinced he would lose to Trump in a general election.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I believe I would defeat Donald Trump in a general election, Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But he still thinks he could win the Republican nomination? In a field he calls dominated by liberals? That seems contradictory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he still thinks he could win the Republican nomination? In a field he calls dominated by liberals? That seems contradictory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. And he praised Trump as a, like, a savior figure in that press release.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. And he praised Trump as a, like, a savior figure in that press release.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the editorial, the former New York City mayor called Trump a threat to our country and emphasized the need to nominate a Democratic candidate who could beat him in the general election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: From a lifelong Democrat, that's pretty surprising. He even complimented congressional Democrats for supporting the president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: From a lifelong Democrat, that's pretty surprising. He even complimented congressional Democrats for supporting the president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which president though? Because if he's talking about Trump, that's just bizarre for a Democrat to say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which president though? Because if he's talking about Trump, that's just bizarre for a Democrat to say.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then there's this thing about Elon Musk's tweet putting his CEO role at risk again with the SEC involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then there's this thing about Elon Musk's tweet putting his C E O role at risk again with the S E C involved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk's Tesla Tweet Puts CEO Role At Risk Again Elon Musk's in trouble for another tweet and this time, the Securities an...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the SEC is apparently very pleased about it, which can't be good for Musk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the S E C is apparently very pleased about it, which can't be good for Musk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So much drama in one press release. Bloomberg endorsing an independent like Howard Schultz too, saying it would guarantee Trump's reelection.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So much drama in one press release. Bloomberg endorsing an independent like Howard Schultz too, saying it would guarantee Trump's reelection.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In January, he obliquely criticized the possible candidacy of Howard Schultz, the billionaire founder of Starbucks, saying that the great likelihood is that an independent candidate would just split the anti-Trump vote and end up reelecting the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like he's trying to shape the field without being in it, you know? Using his money and influence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like he's trying to shape the field without being in it, you know? Using his money and influence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And with a net worth of five point six billion, he's got plenty to throw around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And with a net worth of five point six billion, he's got plenty to throw around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg is worth an estimated $55.6 billion; he placed ninth on Forbes 2019 rankings of the Worlds Billionaires.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Ninth on the Forbes list—he's not exactly short on cash to make these moves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ninth on the Forbes list-he's not exactly short on cash to make these moves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg is worth an estimated $55.6 billion; he placed ninth on Forbes 2019 rankings of the Worlds Billionaires.

artist_script:
Oil and gas production is where Michael Bloomberg is putting his money and his focus for the next two years.
HostA: That's a huge shift from his previous climate initiatives, right? He's completely pivoting.
HostB: Yeah, and he's also planning to spend, um, five hundred million dollars of his own money to help Trump's campaign.
HostA: Which is wild because he spent a hundred million against Republicans just a few years ago in the midterms. It’s a total reversal.
HostB: And he’s not even running himself! He wrote that he’s convinced he would lose to Trump in a general election.
HostA: But he still thinks he could win the Republican nomination? In a field he calls dominated by liberals? That seems contradictory.
HostB: It really does. And he praised Trump as a, like, a savior figure in that press release.
HostA: From a lifelong Democrat, that’s pretty surprising. He even complimented congressional Democrats for supporting the president.
HostB: Which president though? Because if he’s talking about Trump, that’s just bizarre for a Democrat to say.
HostA: Exactly. And then there’s this thing about Elon Musk’s tweet putting his CEO role at risk again with the SEC involved.
HostB: Oh yeah, the SEC is apparently very pleased about it, which can't be good for Musk.
HostA: So much drama in one press release. Bloomberg endorsing an independent like Howard Schultz too, saying it would guarantee Trump’s reelection.
HostB: It feels like he’s trying to shape the field without being in it, you know? Using his money and influence.
HostA: For sure. And with a net worth of five point six billion, he’s got plenty to throw around.
HostB: Ninth on the Forbes list—he’s not exactly short on cash to make these moves.
